means.word_mean: 用于表示简单将来式) 将, 要, 会

sentences.en: I will let you know about it as soon as we come to any conclusion.
sentences.cn: 我们一得出结论, 我就会让你知道。

sentences.en: Will you be free tomorrow afternoon?
sentences.cn: 你明天下午有空吗?

sentences.en: They say that it will rain tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 他们说明天将会下雨。

sentences.en: I will help him if he asks me.
sentences.cn: 只要他提出, 我愿意帮助他。

sentences.en: And I will take care of you, I promise.
sentences.cn: 我保证, 我一定照顾你。

sentences.en: You will allow us to retire.
sentences.cn: 请允许我们告退。

sentences.en: Help me with this baggage, will you?
sentences.cn: 请你帮我搬这件行李好吗?

sentences.en: That will be my brother ringing.
sentences.cn: 按铃的可能是我哥哥。

means.word_mean: (用于表示推测, 与must类似)大概, 可能

sentences.en: The man with the umbrella will be the Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 拿着雨伞的那个人准是首相。

means.word_mean: (表示总是如此) 惯于, 总是

sentences.en: Oil will float on water.
sentences.cn: 油总是浮在水面上。

sentences.en: Man will die.
sentences.cn: 人总是要死的。

means.word_mean: 用意志力驱使(某事发生)

sentences.en: He who wills success is halfway to it.
sentences.cn: 热切争取成功等于成功了一半。

sentences.en: She willed herself to bury her past.
sentences.cn: 她努力使自己忘记过去。

sentences.en: He willed that his property be divided equally among his children.
sentences.cn: 他在遗嘱中讲明将自己的财产均分给子女。

sentences.en: Grandfather willed my brother his car.
sentences.cn: 祖父立下遗嘱把他的车留给了哥哥。

sentences.en: She willed her house to her sister.
sentences.cn: 她把房子遗赠给她妹妹。

sentences.en: Go where you will.
sentences.cn: 你愿意上哪儿就上哪儿。

sentences.en: Fate has willed it otherwise.
sentences.cn: 命运偏不如此安排。

sentences.en: God wills that man should be happy.
sentences.cn: 上帝愿人类幸福。

sentences.en: Will can conquer habit.
sentences.cn: 意志能战胜习惯。

sentences.en: She'll need an iron will in order to succeed.
sentences.cn: 她若想成功, 需要有很强的意志力。

means.word_mean: 决断, 意图, 决心

sentences.en: I felt he had a strong will.
sentences.cn: 我觉得他决心很大。

sentences.en: Where there is a will, there is a way.
sentences.cn: 有志者, 事竟成。

sentences.en: What is his will in the matter?
sentences.cn: 他在这件事上的意图是什么?

sentences.en: He told me that he didn't know the content of the will.
sentences.cn: 他告诉我他不知道遗嘱的内容。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)［表示愿意遵照他人的请求、建议去做］行，好的

jx.jx_cn_mean: 恰在或当一个人希望的时候

entry.def: You use will to indicate that you hope, think, or have evidence that something is going to happen or be the case in the future.

example.ex: The Prime Minister is now 64 years old and in all probability this will be the last election that he is likely to contest...
example.tran: 首相现年64岁，这多半将会是他可能参加的最后一次选举了。

example.ex: You will find a wide variety of choices available in school cafeterias...
example.tran: 在学校的自助餐厅里你会发现有很多饮食可供选择。

entry.def: You use will in order to make statements about official arrangements in the future.

example.ex: The show will be open to the public at 2pm; admission will be 50p...
example.tran: 演出下午两点开始，入场费50便士。

example.ex: When will I be released, sir?
example.tran: 什么时候放我出去，先生？

entry.def: You use will in order to make promises and threats about what is going to happen or be the case in the future.

example.ex: I'll call you tonight...
example.tran: 我晚上会给你打电话。

example.ex: Price quotes on selected product categories will be sent on request...
example.tran: 所选产品类别的报价承索即寄。

entry.def: You use will to indicate someone's intention to do something.

example.ex: I will say no more on these matters, important though they are...
example.tran: 虽然这些事很重要，我也不想再说什么了。

example.ex: In this section we will describe common myths about cigarettes, alcohol, and marijuana...
example.tran: 在这一节，我们将说明有关烟、酒和大麻的常见谬论。

entry.def: You use will in questions in order to make polite invitations or offers.
entry.tran: (用于问句，表示礼貌地邀请或提议)愿否，…好吗

example.ex: Will you stay for supper?...
example.tran: 你愿意留下吃晚饭吗？

example.ex: Will you join me for a drink?...
example.tran: 你愿意跟我一起喝一杯吗？

entry.def: You use will in questions in order to ask or tell someone to do something.
entry.tran: (用于问句中，表示请求或让某人做某事)…好吗，…行吗

example.ex: Will you drive me home?...
example.tran: 你开车送我回家好吗？

example.ex: Will you listen again, Andrew?...
example.tran: 安德鲁，再听一遍好吗？

entry.def: You can use will in statements to give an order to someone.

example.ex: You will do as I request, if you please...
example.tran: 请按我的要求做。

example.ex: You will now maintain radio silence...
example.tran: 现在请保持无线电静默。

entry.def: You use will to say that someone is willing to do something. You use will not or won't to indicate that someone refuses to do something.

example.ex: All right, I'll forgive you...
example.tran: 好吧，我愿意原谅你。

example.ex: I'll answer the phone...
example.tran: 我来接电话。

entry.def: You use will to say that a person or thing is able to do something in the future.

example.ex: How the country will defend itself in the future has become increasingly important...
example.tran: 国家将来如何能自卫已经变得越来越重要了。

example.ex: How will I recognize you?
example.tran: 我怎样才能认出你呢？

entry.def: You use will to indicate that an action usually happens in the particular way mentioned.
entry.tran: (表示行为发生的经常性、习惯性)经常，惯于，总是

example.ex: The thicker the material, the less susceptible the garment will be to wet conditions...
example.tran: 布料越厚实，衣服就越不容易浸湿。

example.ex: There's no snake known that will habitually attack human beings unless threatened with its life...
example.tran: 除非自己的生命受到了威胁，已知的蛇中还没有习惯性地攻击人类的。

entry.def: You use will in the main clause of some 'if' and 'unless' sentences to indicate something that you consider to be fairly likely to happen.
entry.tran: (用于含有 if 和 unless 的句子的主句中，表示非常可能发生)会，就

example.ex: If you overcook the pancakes they will be difficult to roll...
example.tran: 如果薄饼烙久了，就很难卷起来。

example.ex: If a nuclear war breaks out, every living thing will be wiped off the face of the Earth...
example.tran: 如果核战争爆发，地球上的所有生物都会被毁灭。

entry.def: You use will to say that someone insists on behaving or doing something in a particular way and you cannot change them. You emphasize will when you use it in this way.

example.ex: He will leave his socks lying all over the place and it drives me mad.
example.tran: 他非要把袜子扔得到处都是，这简直要让我疯掉了。

entry.def: You use will have with a past participle when you are saying that you are fairly certain that something will be true by a particular time in the future.
entry.tran: (与过去分词连用，表示非常肯定将来会发生某事)定会

example.ex: As many as ten-million children will have been infected with the virus by the end of the decade...
example.tran: 到这个十年结束时，多达千万的儿童将会感染上这种病毒。

example.ex: He will have left by January the fifteenth.
example.tran: 到1月15日他肯定已经离开了。

entry.def: You use will have with a past participle to indicate that you are fairly sure that something is the case.
entry.tran: (与过去分词连用，表示相当肯定)会，将

example.ex: If someone has been in captivity for a long time, he will have changed as a result of his experience...
example.tran: 如果某人遭到长时间囚禁，他会因为他的经历而有所改变。

example.ex: The holiday will have done him the world of good.
example.tran: 假期定会对他大有好处。

usage_note.note: Will is a modal verb. It is used with the base form of a verb. In spoken English and informal written English, the form won't is often used in negative statements.
usage_note.translation: will是情态动词，与动词原形连用。在口语与非正式书面语中，否定形式常用 won't。

entry.def: Will is the determination to do something.

example.ex: He was said to have lost his will to live.
example.tran: 据说他已经失去了生存的意志。

example.ex: ...the inevitable battle of wills as your child realizes that he can't do or have everything he wants...
example.tran: 当孩子意识到他不能随心所欲地想干什么就干什么、想要什么就有什么的时候，他和父母之间意志的较量就不可避免

entry.def: If something is the will of a person or group of people with authority, they want it to happen.

example.ex: He has submitted himself to the will of God...
example.tran: 他让自己听从上帝的意志。

example.ex: Democracy responds and adjusts to the will of the people...
example.tran: 民主响应并顺应人民的意志。

entry.def: If you will something to happen, you try to make it happen by using mental effort rather than physical effort.

example.ex: I looked at the telephone, willing it to ring...
example.tran: 我看着电话，希望它响起来。

example.ex: He was watching her fixedly, willing her to look at him.
example.tran: 他凝视着她，希望她也看他。

entry.def: A will is a document in which you declare what you want to happen to your money and property when you die.

example.ex: Attached to his will was a letter he had written to his wife just days before his death.
example.tran: 和遗嘱附在一起的是一封他去世前几天写给妻子的信。

entry.def: If you will something to someone, you say in your will that they should have it when you die.

example.ex: The large sum of money that came to him when she died was a shock, and he had not spent a penny of it on himself. He had, however, willed it to Frank.
example.tran: 她去世时他继承的那一大笔钱数额惊人，但他在自己身上未花分文，而是将其遗赠给了弗兰克。

entry.def: If something is done against your will, it is done even though you do not want it to be done.
entry.tran: 违背…的意志;违背…的愿望

example.ex: No doubt he was forced to leave his family against his will.
example.tran: 无疑，他是不情愿地被迫离家的。

entry.def: If you can do something at will, you can do it when you want and as much as you want.

example.ex: ...scientists who can adjust their experiments at will.
example.tran: 可以任意对实验进行调整的科学家

entry.def: If you do something with a will, you do it with a lot of enthusiasm and energy.

example.ex: Set to work with a will and be pleased with the amount you get done...
example.tran: 干活时卖力干，干了多少都满意。

example.ex: It was an easy opening circuit, but the riders attacked it with a will.
example.tran: 这一段起始赛道十分平缓，但车手们都铆足了劲往前冲。

means.word_mean: 1. the capability of conscious choice and decision and intention;

sentences.sentence: "the exercise of their volition we construe as revolt"- George Meredith

means.word_mean: 2. a fixed and persistent intent or purpose;

sentences.sentence: "where there's a will there's a way"

means.word_mean: 3. a legal document declaring a person's wishes regarding the disposal of their property when they die
4. leave or give by will after one's death;

sentences.sentence: "My aunt bequeathed me all her jewelry"
"My grandfather left me his entire estate"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wyllan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch willen, German wollen, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin velle 'will, wish'
Old English willa (noun), willian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wil, German Wille (nouns), also to will and the adverb well
